data.quote: Liberty is always dangerous - but it is the safest thing we have.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: Let the word go forth from this time and place  to friend and foe alike  that the torch has been passed to a new generation of Americans - born in this century  tempered by war  disciplined by a hard and bitter peace  proud of our ancient heritage - and unwilling to witness or permit the slow undoing of those human rights to which this nation has always been committed  and to which we are committed today at home and around the world. Let every nation know  whether it wishes us well or ill  that we shall pay any price  bear any burden  meet any hardship  support any friend  oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty. All this will not be finished in the first 100 days. Nor will it be finished in the first 1 000 days  nor in the life of this administration  nor even perhaps in our lifetime on this planet. But let us begin. Now the trumpet summons us again - not as a call to bear arms  though arms we need - not as a call to battle  though embattled we are - but a call to bear the burden of a long twilight struggle  year in and year out  "rejoicing in hope  patient in tribulation"- a struggle against the common enemies of man: tyranny  poverty  disease and war itself. And so  my fellow Americans  ask not what your country can do for you - ask what you can do for your country . My fellow citizens of the world: ask not what America will do for you  but what together we can do for the freedom of man.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: None can love freedom heartily  but good men - the rest love not freedom  but licence.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: One should never put on one's best trousers to go out to battle for freedom and truth.
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: I understand by 'freedom of spirit' something quite definite - the unconditional will to say No  where it is dangerous to say No.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Man was born free and everywhere he is in shackles.
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: For two decades the state has been taking liberties  and these liberties were once ours.
data.author: E. P. Thompson

data.quote: By physical liberty I mean the right to do anything which does not interfere with the happiness of another. By intellectual liberty I mean the right to think wrong.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: There can be no real freedom without the freedom to fail.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Liberty  as it is conceived by current opinion  has nothing inherent about it  it is a sort of gift or trust bestowed on the individual by the state pending good behaviour.
data.author: Mary McCarthy

data.quote: The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously.
data.author: Hubert Humphrey

data.quote: If liberty has any meaning it means freedom to improve.
data.author: Philip Wylie

data.quote: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must  like men  undergo the fatigue of supporting it.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: Let every nation know  whether it wishes us well or ill  that we shall pay any price  bear any burden  meet any hardship  support any friend  oppose any foe  in order to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: The most stringent protection of free speech would not protect a man in falsely shouting fire in a theatre and causing a panic... The question in every case is whether the words used are used in such circumstances and are of such a nature as to create a clear and present danger that they will bring about the substantive evils that Congress has a right to prevent.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Send these  the homeless  tempest toss'd  to me. I lift my lamp beside the golden door.
data.author: Emma Lazarus

data.quote: To be truly free  it takes more determination  courage  introspection and restraint than to be in shackles.
data.author: Pietro Bellusch

data.quote: Equality of opportunity is an equal opportunity to prove unequal talents.
data.author: Viscount Samuel

data.quote: The greatest right in the world is the right to be wrong.
data.author: Harry Weinberger

data.quote: We who lived in concentration camps can remember the men who walked through the huts comforting others  giving away their last piece of bread. They may have been few in number  but they offer sufficient proof that everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of human freedoms - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances - to choose one's own way.
data.author: Viktor Frankl

data.quote: The world must be made safe for democracy. Its peace must be planted upon the tested foundations of political liberty. We have no selfish ends to serve. We desire no conquest  no domination. We seek no indemnities for ourselves  no material compensation for the sacrifices we shall freely give. We are but one of the champions of the rights of mankind. We shall be satisfied when those rights have been made as secure as the faith and freedom of nations can make them.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: A free man is as jealous of his responsibilities as he is of his liberties.
data.author: Cyril James

data.quote: All free men  wherever they may live  are citizens of Berlin. And therefore  as a free man  I take pride in the words 'Ich bin ein Berliner.'
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Liberty is the right to do what the law permits.
data.author: Baron de Montesquieu

data.quote: Once freedom lights its beacon in a man's heart  the gods are powerless against him.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: Equality is the result of human organization. We are not born equal.
data.author: Hannah Arendt

data.quote: When you have robbed a man of everything  he is no longer in your power. He is free again.
data.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

data.quote: The effect of liberty on individuals is that they may do what they please: we ought to see what it will please them to do  before we risk congratulations.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: We are in bondage to the law in order that we may be free.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: People hardly ever make use of the freedom they have  for example  freedom of thought  instead they demand freedom of speech as a compensation.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: The tree of liberty grows only when watered by the blood of tyrants.
data.author: Bertrand Barere

data.quote: The people never give up their liberties but under some delusion.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Liberty's in every blow! Let us do or die.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty.
data.author: John Philpot Curran

data.quote: Those who would give up essential liberty to purchase a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Give me liberty  or give me death.
data.author: Patrick Henry

data.quote: The God who gave us life  gave us liberty at the same time.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Give me your tired  your poor  Your huddled masses  yearning to breathe free  The wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these  the homeless  tempest tossed  to me: I lift my lamp beside the golden door.
data.author: Emma Lazarus

data.quote: Give me the liberty to know  to think  to believe  and to utter freely according to conscience  above all other liberties.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: 0 liberty! how many crimes are committed in thy name!
data.author: Mme. Jeanne Roland

data.quote: Liberty is the only thing you cannot have unless you are willing to give it to others.
data.author: William Allen White

data.quote: Liberty and Union  now and for ever  one and inseparable!
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: 1 have always in my own thought summed up individual liberty  and business liberty  and every other kind of liberty  in the phrase that is common in the sporting world  "A free field and no favor."
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: If anything happens to me  tell every woman I've ever gone with I was talking about her at the end. That way  they'll have to reevaluate me.
data.author: Albert Brooks

data.quote: They say such nice things about people at their funerals that it makes me sad to realize I'm going to miss mine by just a few days.
data.author: Garrison Keillor

data.quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work  I want to achieve it through not dying.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: For my family to go on living the way they are living now  I can't just die. I've got to die accidentally.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I don't want to tell you how much insurance I carry with Prudential. All I can say is: When I go  they go!

data.quote: Let us so live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: The trouble with life in the fast lane is that you get to the other end in an awful hurry.
data.author: John Jensen

data.quote: Memorial services are the cocktail parties of the geriatric set.
data.author: Harold Macmillan

data.quote: I won't mind dying if I can tell St. Peter a joke he hasn't heard.
data.author: Red Skelton

data.quote: The other night  while lying on a couch  I reviewed the high point of my life and fell asleep!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My mother always said that every time you do a good deed here on Earth  you're storing up a treasure in heaven. Which means Mother Teresa's probably got some beachfront property up there and I'm up to a box of Milk Duds and a Pez dispenser.
data.author: Robert G. Lee

data.quote: Why this fuss about death? Use your imagination  try to visualize a world without death.
data.author: Charlotte Gilman

data.quote: Ninety percent of living is just showing up.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: Everybody's gotta die sometime. That's life.
data.author: Archie Bunker

data.quote: Planned obsolescence isn't a new idea -  God always used it with people.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: I want to die like my grandfather died . . . peacefully in his sleep. Not like the other three people screaming in the car.
data.author: Joey Adams

data.quote: I don't want to put my life in the hands of any doctor who believes in reincarnation. Give me a good old-fashioned American doc who'll make sure you live to pay that bill.
data.author: Glen Super

data.quote: The only thing I regret about my life is the length of it. If I had to live my life again  I'd make all the same mistakes - only sooner.
data.author: Tallulah Bankhead

data.quote: Life doesn't imitate art  it imitates bad television.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: When fate's got it in for you  there's no limit to what you may have to put up with.
data.author: Georgette Heyer

data.quote: I do not believe in an afterlife  although I am bringing a change of underwear.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: He wasn't one who wanted to look back on his life and say  "I wish I spent more time in the office."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Being of sound mind  I spent every cent I ever had.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If life was fair  Elvis would be alive and all the impersonators would be dead.
data.author: Johnny Carson

data.quote: The best way to get praise is to die.

data.quote: No matter how rich you become  how famous or powerful  when you die the size of your funeral will still pretty much depend on the weather.

data.quote: I'm not afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.

data.quote: Life is like a B-movie. You don't want to leave in the middle of it  but you don't want to see it again.

data.quote: If you don't go to people's funerals  they won't come to yours.

data.quote: Life is something that happens to you while you're making other plans.
data.author: Margaret Miller

data.quote: Life is not a dress rehearsal.

data.quote: St. Teresa of Avila described our life in this world as like a night in a second-class hotel.

data.quote: If your time hasn't come  not even a doctor can kill you.
data.author: M. A. Perlstein

data.quote: I know a man who gave up smoking  drinking  sex  and rich food. He was healthy right up to the time he killed himself.

data.quote: Death is just nature's way of telling you to slow down.

data.quote: The world is a beautiful place to be born into if you don't mind some people dying all the time or maybe only starving some of the time which isn't half so bad if it isn't you.

data.quote: A tragedy means always a man's struggle with that which is stronger than man.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: After the game  the king and pawn go into the same box.
data.author: Italian proverb

data.quote: All men should strive to learn before they die what they are running from  and to  and why.

data.quote: And how am I to face the odds of man's bedevilment and God's? I  a stranger and afraid in a world I never made.

data.quote: I like life. It's something to do. Somewhere on this globe every 10 seconds  there is a woman giving birth to a child. She must be found and stopped.
data.author: Sam Levenson

data.quote: Cats and monkeys - monkeys and cats - all human life is there.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: Clay lies still but blood's a rover  Breath's a ware that will not keep Up  lad  when the journey's over There'll be time enough to sleep.

data.quote: Don't do things to not die  do things to enjoy living. The by-product may be not dying.

data.quote: Everything I did in my life that was worthwhile I caught Hell for.

data.quote: Give me neither poverty nor riches  feed me with food convenient for me.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I haven't heard of anybody who wants to stop living on account of the cost.
data.author: F. McKinney Hubbard

data.quote: I try to take one day at a time  but sometimes several days attack me at once.

data.quote: If there is another world  he lives in bliss If there is none  he made the best of this.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: If way to the Better there be  it exacts a full look at the Worst.
data.author: Thomas Hardy

data.quote: If you won't be better tomorrow than you were today  then what do you need tomorrow for?
data.author: Rabbi Nahman of Bratslav

data.quote: In the morning a man walks with his whole body  in the evening  only with his legs.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Is not this the true romantic feeling - not to desire to escape life  but to prevent life from escaping you.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: Life is a handful of short stories  pretending to be a novel.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: Life is all memory  except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Life is better than death  I believe  if only because it is less boring and because it has fresh peaches in it.
data.author: Thomas Walker

data.quote: Life is for each man a solitary cell whose walls are mirrors.
data.author: Eugene O'Neill

data.quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism  the way you play it is free will.

data.quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.

data.quote: Life is the only art that we are required to practise without preparation  and without being allowed the preliminary trials  the failures and botches  that are essential for the training of a mere beginner.

data.quote: Magnificently unprepared for the long littleness of life.

data.quote: Man wants but little here below nor wants that little long.

data.quote: Oh for a life of sensations rather than of thoughts.

data.quote: Our insignificance is often the cause of our safety.

data.quote: Sometimes I wish life had a fast-forward button.

data.quote: St. Teresa of Avila described our life in this world as like a night at a second-class hotel.
data.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

data.quote: The character of human life  like the character of the human condition  like the character of all life  is "ambiguity": the inseparable mixture of good and evil  the true and false  the creative and destructive forces - both individual and social.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: The closing years of life are like the end of a masquerade party  when the masks are dropped.

data.quote: The expression often used by Mr. Herbert Spencer of the Survival of the Fittest is more accurate and is sometimes equally convenient.

data.quote: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is the example of the eternal seductiveness of life.

data.quote: The great business of life is to be  to do  to do without and to depart.
data.author: John Morley

data.quote: The Indian Summer of life should be a little sunny and a little sad  like the season  and infinite in wealth and depth of tone - but never hustled.

data.quote: The loveliest of trees  the cherry now is hung with bloom along the bough  and stands about the woodland ride wearing white for Eastertide.

data.quote: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win  you're still a rat.
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: The vanity of human life is like a river  constantly passing away  and yet constantly coming on.

data.quote: The world is made up of people who never quite get into the first team and who just miss the prizes at the flower show.

data.quote: There are days when it takes all you've got just to keep up with the losers.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: This is the Law of the Yukon  that only the strong shall thrive  That surely the weak shall perish  and only the fit survive.

data.quote: This is the true joy in life  the being used for a purpose recognized by yourself as a mighty one  the being thoroughly worn out before you are thrown on the scrap heap.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: We live in what is  but we find 1 000 ways not to face it. Great theatre strengthens our faculty to face it.

data.quote: When the world has once begun to use us ill  and afterwards continues the same treatment with less scruple or ceremony  as men do to a whore.

data.quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless  it cannot hold itself together.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Life only demands from the strength you possess. Only one feat is possible - not to have run away.

data.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life. It goes on.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Life is ours to be spent  not to be saved.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Life is a luminous halo  a semi-transparent envelope surrounding us from the beginning.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: Life is ever since man was born  licking honey from a thorn.
data.author: Louis Ginsberg

data.quote: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.

data.quote: Life is like playing a violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.
data.author: Clarence Darrow

data.quote: The great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
data.author: Walter Bagehot

data.quote: Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day.

data.quote: Life is action and passion  therefore  it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of the time  at peril of being judged not to have lived.

data.quote: The joy of life is variety  the tenderest love requires to be renewed by intervals of absence.

data.quote: O Life! thou art a galling load  Along a rough  a weary road  to wretches such as I.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: I am on the side of the unregenerate who affirm the worth of life as an end in itself  as against the saints who deny it.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: The natural rhythm of human life is routine punctuated by orgies.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Were the offer made true  I would engage to run again  from beginning to end  the same career of life. All I would ask should be the privilege of an author  to correct  in a second edition  certain errors of the first.

data.quote: Life is what happens to us while we are making other plans.
data.author: Thomas la Mance

data.quote: The man who has no inner life is the slave of his surroundings.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: People in the West are always getting ready to live.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: You've got to keep fighting - you've got to risk your life every six months to stay alive.
data.author: Elia Kazan

data.quote: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty  you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: Life  as it is called  is for most of us one long postponement.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Life is a progress from want to want  not from enjoyment to enjoyment.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Life as we find it is too hard for us  it entails too much pain  too many disappointments  impossible tasks. We cannot do without palliative remedies.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: Be intent upon the perfection of the present day.
data.author: William Law

data.quote: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: You only live once - but if you work it right  once is enough.
data.author: Joe E. Lewis

data.quote: Growth is the only evidence of life.

data.quote: Life is a stranger's sojourn  a night at an inn.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: If you're on the merry-go-round  you have to go round.

data.quote: Most people get a fair amount of fun out of their lives  but on balance life is suffering and only the very sound or the very foolish imagine otherwise.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: The whole of what we know is a system of compensations. Each suffering is rewarded  each sacrifice is made up  every debt is paid.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The truth that many people never understand  until it is too late  is that the more you try to avoid suffering the more you suffer because smaller and more insignificant things begin to torture you in proportion to your fear of being hurt.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer  but rather what they miss.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward  but he who has hope for it is a fool.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Basically  I'm interested in friendship  sex and death.
data.author: Sharon Riis

data.quote: Such as we are made of  such we be.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Measurement of life should be proportioned rather to the intensity of the experience than to its actual length.
data.author: Thomas Hardy

data.quote: Life is seldom as unendurable as  to judge by the facts  it logically ought to be.
data.author: Brooks Atkinson

data.quote: Birth  copulation and death. That's all the facts when you come to brass tacks.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Life is an offensive  directed against the repetitious mechanism of the universe.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: There is no cure for birth and death  save to enjoy the interval.

data.quote: The art of living is more like that of wrestling than of dancing. The main thing is to stand firm and be ready for an unforeseen attack.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: We never live  but we are always in the expectation of living.

data.quote: Life  we learn too late  is in the living  in the tissue of every day and hour.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.
data.author: Coco Chanel

data.quote: It is not the years in your life but the life in your years that counts.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us. To live is to be slowly born.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: One hour of life  crowded to the full with glorious action  and filled with noble risks  is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum.

data.quote: The good life  as I conceive it  is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy - I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: One man in his time plays many parts.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: He alone deserves liberty and life who daily must win them anew.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: One returns to the place one came from.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: The true meaning of life is to plant trees  under whose shade you do not expect to sit.
data.author: Nelson Henderson

data.quote: It is now life and not art that requires the willing suspension of disbelief.
data.author: Lionel Trilling

data.quote: The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Life is painting a picture  not doing a sum.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Go placidly amid the noise and the haste  and remember what peace there may be in silence. As far as possible without surrender  be on good terms with all persons. Speak your truth quietly and clearly  and listen to others  even the dull and ignorant  they too have their story. Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection. Neither be cynical about love - for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment it is as perennial as the grass. Take kindly the counsel of the years  gracefully surrendering the things of youth. Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune. But do not distress yourself with imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness. Beyond a wholesome discipline  be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe no less than the trees and the stars  you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you  no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should. Therefore be at peace with God  whatever you conceive Him to be  and whatever your labours and aspirations  in the noisy confusion of life keep peace with your soul. With all its sham  drudgery and broken dreams  it is still a beautiful world.
data.author: Max Ehrmann

data.quote: At any given moment life is completely senseless. But viewed over a period  it seems to reveal itself as an organism existing in time  having a purpose  tending in a certain direction.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Without a measureless and perpetual uncertainty  the drama of human life would be destroyed.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: For he who lives more lives than one  more deaths than one must die.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: It is better to wear out than to rust out.
data.author: George Whitefield

data.quote: My advice to those who are about to begin  in earnest  the journey of life  is to take their heart in one hand and a club in the other.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: One must choose in life between boredom and suffering.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: All of life is more or less what the French would call s'imposer - to be able to create one's own terms for what one does.
data.author: Kenneth Tynan

data.quote: The power of habit and the charm of novelty are the two adverse forces which explain the follies of mankind.
data.author: Comtesse Diane

data.quote: Real life seems to have no plots.
data.author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

data.quote: There are two ways to slide easily through life  to believe everything or doubt everything. Both ways save us from thinking.
data.author: Alfred Korzybski

data.quote: Life is one long process of getting tired.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: He who has a why to live can bear with almost any how.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Oh  how daily life is. (Ah  que la vie est quotidienne.)
data.author: Jules Laforgue

data.quote: Death and taxes and childbirth. There's never any convenient time for any of them.
data.author: Margaret Mitchell

data.quote: We're all in this together - by ourselves.
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  savour you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow. Let me hold you while I may  for it will not always be so. One day I shall dig my nails into the earth  or bury my face in the pillow  or stretch myself taut  or raise my hands to the sky  and want  more than all the world  your return.
data.author: Mary Jean Irion

data.quote: A proverb is no proverb to you till life has illustrated it.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: Sloppy  raggedy-assed old life. I love it. I never want to die.
data.author: Dennis Trudell

data.quote: It is not true that life is one damn thing after another- it's one damn thing over and over.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: In our life there is a single color  as on an artist's palette  which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
data.author: Marc Chagall

data.quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: To fear love is to fear life  and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: We are most alive when we're in love.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of our tasks  the ultimate  the last test and proof  the work for which all other work is but preparation.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: And whatever it is that keeps widening your heart  that's Mary  too  not only the power inside you but the love. And when you get down to it  Lily  that's the only purpose grand enough for a human life. Not just to love - but to persist in love.
data.author: Sue Monk Kidd

data.quote: Where there is love there is life.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Loving people live in a loving world. Hostile people live in a hostile world. Same world.
data.author: Wayne W. Dyer

data.quote: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love  love  love  that is the soul of genius.
data.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

data.quote: Love is like pi - natural  irrational  and very important.
data.author: Lisa Hoffman

data.quote: What the world really needs is more love and less paperwork.
data.author: Pearl Bailey

data.quote: I love humanity but I hate people.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: To live is like to love - all reason is against it  and all healthy instinct for it.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossom and fruit.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Love looks through a telescope  envy through a microscope.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: In the arithmetic of love  one plus one equals everything  and two minus one equals nothing.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: There is only one happiness in life: to love and be loved.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: To love means not to impose your own powers on your fellow man but offer him your help. And if he refuses it  to be proud that he can do it on his own strength.
data.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

data.quote: Love is like the truth  sometimes it prevails  sometimes it hurts.
data.author: Victor M. Garcia

data.quote: If love is the answer  could you please rephrase the question?
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: The Grand essentials of happiness are: something to do  something to love  and something to hope for.
data.author: Allan K. Chalmers

data.quote: The love of life is necessary to the vigorous prosecution of any undertaking.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: I have been so great a lover: filled my days So proudly with the splendour of Love's praise  The pain  the calm  and the astonishment  Desire illimitable  and silent content  And all dear names men use  to cheat despair  For the perplexed and viewless streams that bear Our hearts at random down the dark of life.
data.author: Rupert Brooke

data.quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: There can be no peace of mind in love  since the advantage one has secured is never anything by a fresh starting-point for further desires.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: What I cannot love  I overlook.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: A loving relationship is one in which the loved one is free to be himself - to laugh with me  but never at me  to cry with me  but never because of me  to love life  to love himself  to love being loved. Such a relationship is based upon freedom and can never grow in a jealous heart.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: We are all born for love  it is the principle of existence and its only end.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Love is the only thing that we can carry with us when we go  and it makes the end so easy.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: Among those whom I like or admire  I can find no common denominator  but among those whom I love  I can: all of them make me laugh.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: Life isn't long enough for love and art.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: The essence of love is kindness.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Love . . . includes fellowship in suffering  in joy and in effort.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power  the world will know peace.
data.author: Jimi Hendrix

data.quote: Love is anterior to life Posterior to death Initial of creation  and The exponent of breath.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air  is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars.
data.author: Henry Van Dyke

data.quote: Love is ever the beginning of Knowledge as fire is of light.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Life in common among people who love each other is the ideal of happiness.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: I wonder what memories of yours will persist as you go on in life. My hunch is that the most important will have to do with feelings of loving and being loved - whoever's been close to you. As you continue to grow  you'll find many ways of expressing your love and you'll discover more and more ways in which others express their love for you.
data.author: Fred Rogers

data.quote: Where love is  no room is too small.
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: If music be the food of love  play on  Give me excess of it  that  surfeiting  The appetite may sicken  and so die. That strain again! it had a dying fall: O  it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love  something to do  and something to hope for.
data.author: Tom Bodett

data.quote: It is love  not reason  that is stronger than death.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: Love feels no burden  regards not labors  strives toward more than it attains  argues not of impossibility  since it believes that it may and can do all things. Therefore it avails for all things  and fulfils and accomplishes much where one not a lover falls and lies helpless.
data.author: Thomas a Kempis

data.quote: Love your neighbor as yourself  but don't take down the fence.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: There is no better exercise for strengthening the heart than reaching down and lifting up another.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Love does not dominate  it cultivates.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: Love is letting go of fear.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: If we all discovered that we only had five minutes left to say all that we wanted to say  every telephone booth would be occupied by people calling other people to tell them that they loved them.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: Love doesn't make the world go round  Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love  to some extent  protects you from age.
data.author: Jeanne Moreau

data.quote: And remember  my sentimental friend  that a heart is not judged by how much you love  but by how much you are loved by others.
data.author: L. Frank Baum

data.quote: Love's like the measles - all the worse when it comes late in life.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: Ofttimes the test of courage becomes rather to live than to die.
data.author: Vittorio Conte Alfieri

data.quote: Every man's life is a fairy-tale written by God's fingers.
data.author: Hans Christian Andersen

data.quote: Life is a jig saw puzzle with most of the pieces missing.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I expect to pass through this world but once. Any good therefore that I can do  or any kindness that I can show to any fellow creature  let me do it now. Let me not defer or neglect it  for I shall not pass this way again.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We come and we cry  and that is life  we yawn and we depart  and that is death!
data.author: Ausone de Chancel

data.quote: It matters not how long we live  but how.
data.author: Francis Bailey

data.quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
data.author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

data.quote: It is a misery to be born  a pain to live  a trouble to die.
data.author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

data.quote: Life is but a day at most.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: One life - a little gleam of Time between two Eternities.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Hurried and worried until we're buried  and there's no curtain call  Life's a very funny proposition  after all.
data.author: George M. Cohan

data.quote: For life in general  there is but one decree: youth is a blunder  manhood a struggle  old age a regret.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Out of sleeping a waking  Out of waking a sleep.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Our whole life is like a play.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: No one is to be despaired of as long as he breathes. (While there is life there is hope.)
data.author: Erasmus

data.quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: A useless life is an early death.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: All that a man hath will he give for his life.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Life is a tragedy for those who feel  and a comedy for those who think.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: Every life is many days  day after day. We walk through ourselves  meeting robbers  ghosts  giants  old men  young men  wives  widows  brothers-in-love. But always meeting ourselves.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: Tell me not  in mournful numbers  Life is but an empty dream!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Christian life consists in faith and charity.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: Strait is the gate and narrow is the way which leadeth unto life.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: My candle burns at both ends  It will not last the night  But  ah  my foes  and  oh  my friends -  It gives a lovely light.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: Ah Love! could you and I with him conspire To grasp this sorry Scheme of Things entire Would we not shatter it to bits - and then Re-mould it nearer to the Heart's Desire?
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Life is the game that must be played: This truth at least  good friends  we know  So live and laugh  nor be dismayed As one by one the phantoms go.
data.author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

data.quote: I wish to preach not the doctrine of ignoble ease  but the doctrine of the strenuous life.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: As is a tale  so is life: not how long it is  but how good it is  is what matters.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: His saying was: live and let live.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: Out  out  brief candle! Life's but a walking shadow.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: May you live all the days of your life.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: The white flower of a blameless life.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Life is a game of whist. From unseen sources The cards are shuffled  and the hands are dealt. I do not like the way the cards are shuffled  But yet I like the game and want to play.
data.author: Eugene F. Ware

data.quote: Men know life too early  women know life too late.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: All the things I really like to do are either immoral  illegal or fattening.
data.author: Alexander Woollcott

data.quote: And God said  Let there be light: and there was light.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The true light  which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He was a burning and a shining light.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Lead  kindly Light  amid the encircling gloom  Lead Thou me on! The night is dark  and I am far from home -  Lead Thou me on! Keep Thou my feet  I do not ask to see The distant scene  - one step enough for me.
data.author: John Henry Newman

data.quote: And this I know  whether the one True Light Kindle to Love  or Wrath consume me quite  One flash of it within the Tavern caught Better than in the temple lost outright.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night: God said  "Let Newton be!" and all was light.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: A light heart lives long.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative and the second is disastrous.
data.author: Margot Fonteyn

data.quote: Man  unlike the animal  has never learned that the sole purpose of life is to enjoy it.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Life's better when it's fun. Boy  that's deep  isn't it?
data.author: Kevin Costner

data.quote: When a man is gloomy  everything seems to go wrong  when he is cheerful  everything seems right!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Years back someone said cod liver oil was the cure-all! Cheerfulness is more palliative and with no unpleasant aftertaste.
data.author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

data.quote: Cheerfulness keeps up a kind of daylight in the mind  filling it with a steady and perpetual serenity.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: The highest wisdom is continual cheerfulness  such a state  like the region above the moon  is always clear and serene.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Let us be of good cheer  remembering that misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never come.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Burdens become light when cheerfully borne.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: A happy woman is one who has no cares at all  a cheerful woman is one who has cares but doesn't let them get her down.
data.author: Beverly Sills

data.quote: Even if we can't be happy we must always be cheerful.
data.author: Irving Kristol

data.quote: Nature intended you to be the fountain-spring of cheerfulness and social life  and not the mountain of despair and melancholy.
data.author: Sir Arthur Helps

data.quote: You find yourself refreshed by the presence of cheerful people. Why not make an earnest effort to confer that pleasure on others? Half the battle is gained if you never allow yourself to say anything gloomy.
data.author: Lydia Maria Child

data.quote: Cheerfulness is contagious  but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If God came in and said  "I want you to be happy for the rest of your life " what would you do?
data.author: Bernie Siegel

data.quote: True happiness is to understand our duties toward God and man  to enjoy the present  without anxious dependence on the future  not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears  but to rest satisfied with what we have  which is abundantly sufficient.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Many people think that if they were only in some other place  or had some other job  they would be happy. Well  that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: You're happiest while you're making the greatest contribution.
data.author: Robert F. Kennedy

data.quote: The happiest and most contented people are those who each day perform to make the best of their abilities.
data.author: Alfred A. Montapert

data.quote: None but those who are happy in themselves can make others so.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Do you want a world with . . . more joy and happiness? Then find your own joy and happiness and contribute to the joy and happiness of others.
data.author: Bo Lozoff

data.quote: One thing I know  the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Happiness is a perfume which you cannot pour on someone without getting some on yourself.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.
data.author: Booker T. Washington

data.quote: Make people happy and there will not be half the quarreling  or a tenth part of the wickedness there now is.
data.author: Lydia Maria Child

data.quote: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you  and you will be surprised what a happy life you will lead.
data.author: Charles Schwab

data.quote: If you want to be happy  set yourself a goal that commands your thoughts  liberates your energy  and inspires your hopes. Happiness is within you. It comes from doing some certain thing into which you can put all your thought and energy. If you want to be happy  get enthusiastic about something.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
data.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

data.quote: The way to happiness: keep your heart free from hate  your mind from worry. Live simply  expect little  give much. Fill your life with love. Scatter sunshine. Forget self  think of others. Do as you would be done by. Try this for a week and you will be surprised.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little  soon-forgotten charities of a kiss or smile  a kind look  a heartfelt compliment  and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: A happy life is made up of little things . . . a gift sent  a letter written  a call made  a recommendation given  transportation provided  a cake made  a book lent  a check sent.
data.author: Carol Holmes

data.quote: Do not worry  eat three square meals a day  say your prayers  be courteous to your creditors  keep your digestion good  exercise  go slow and easy. Maybe there are other things your special case requires to make you happy  but my friend  these I reckon will give you a good life.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The secret of happiness is this: Let your interests be as wide as possible  and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes  but in liking what one does.
data.author: J. M. Barrie

data.quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings while others are adding up their troubles.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings - not your birthdays.
data.author: Shannon Rose

data.quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: It is not how much we have  but how much we enjoy  that makes happiness.
data.author: Charles Spurgeon

data.quote: Before strongly desiring anything  we should look carefully into the happiness of its present owner.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: We have all been placed on this earth to discover our own path  and we will never be happy if we live someone else's idea of life.
data.author: James Van Praagh

data.quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do  something to love  and something to hope for.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: We all have 100% to deal with in our lives: 10% is important  90% unimportant. The secret to a happy  productive life is to deal with the 10% and let the 90% slip.
data.author: Salli Rasberry

data.quote: With a little discipline and regular self-checks  you can learn to do one thing at a time. And do it better. And be happier doing it.
data.author: Elaine St. James

data.quote: I've been riding the carousel in Central Park since I was five years old . . . If I'm very depressed or if something's bothering me today  my husband  Larry  and I go back to the park. We get on the carousel horse and we start riding  and I start singing at the top of my lungs. It is pure and absolute joy and happiness.
data.author: Eda LeShan

data.quote: It's never too late to have a happy childhood.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life holds so much  so much to be happy about always. Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can be felt only if you don't set any conditions.
data.author: Artur Rubinstein

data.quote: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love  grace  and gratitude.
data.author: Denis Waitley

data.quote: Better to be happy than wise.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: Happiness is a butterfly  which  when pursued  is always just beyond your grasp  but which  if you will sit down quietly  may alight upon you.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: Your success and happiness lie in you. Resolve to keep happy  and your joy and you shall form an invisible host against difficulties.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Remember that happiness is a way of travel  not a destination.
data.author: Roy Goodman

data.quote: When ill luck besets us  to ease the tension we have only to remember that happiness is relative. The next time you are tempted to grumble about what has happened to you  why not pause and be glad that it is no worse than it is?
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: I have found that most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: It is the happiness that comes from within that is lasting and fulfilling.
data.author: Leddy Schmeligh

data.quote: Each person on this planet is inherently  intrinsically capable of attaining "dizzying heights" of happiness and fulfillment.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: The ingredients of happiness are so simple that they can be counted on one hand. Happiness comes from within  and rests most securely on simple goodness and clear conscience.
data.author: William Ogden

data.quote: We are never so happy nor so unhappy as we imagine.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: You have to believe in happiness  or happiness never comes.
data.author: Douglas Malloch

data.quote: It is a man's proper business to seek happiness and avoid misery.
data.author: John Locke

data.quote: The best way to secure future happiness is to be as happy as is rightfully possible today.
data.author: Charles Eliot

data.quote: Why should we refuse the happiness this hour gives us  because some other hour might take it away?
data.author: John Oliver Hobbes

data.quote: At the end of our time on earth  if we have lived fully  we will not be able to say  "I was always happy." Hopefully  we will be able to say  "I have experienced a lifetime of real moments  and many of them were happy moments."
data.author: Barbara DeAngelis

data.quote: Cherish all your happy moments  they make a fine cushion for old age.
data.author: Booth Tarkington

data.quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life  the whole aim and end of human existence.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: Happiness and love are just a choice away.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate. So practice happy thinking every day. Cultivate the merry heart  develop the happiness habit  and life will become a continual feast.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: Humor is the healthy way of feeling "distance" between one's self and the problem  a way of standing off and looking at one's problems with perspective.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: Humor has great power to heal on an emotional level. You can't hold anger  you can't hold fear  you can't hold hurt while you're laughing.
data.author: Steve Bhaerman

data.quote: Humor enables one to live in the midst of tragic events without becoming a tragic figure.
data.author: E. T. Eberhart

data.quote: There is no defense against adverse fortune which is so effectual as an habitual sense of humor.
data.author: Thomas Higginson

data.quote: Humor is our way of defending ourselves from life's absurdities by thinking absurdly about them.
data.author: Lewis Mumford

data.quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing  moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense  dancing.
data.author: Clive James

data.quote: There is always something to chuckle about. Sometimes we see it. Sometimes . . . we don't. Still  the world is filled with humor. It is there when we are happy and it is there to cheer us up when we are not.
data.author: Allen Klein

data.quote: Joy is the most infallible sign of the Presence of God.
data.author: Teilhard de Chardin

data.quote: Listen to the clues. The next time you feel real joy  stop and think. Pay attention. Because joy is the universe's way of knocking on your mind's door. Hello in there. Is anyone home? Can I leave a message? Yes? Good I The message is that you are happy  and that means that you are in touch with your purpose.
data.author: Steve Chandler

data.quote: Joy of life seems to me to arise from a sense of being where one belongs ... of being foursquare with the life we have chosen. All the discontented people I know are trying sedulously to be something they are not  to do something they cannot do.
data.author: David Grayson

data.quote: When we align our thoughts  emotions  and actions with the highest part of ourselves  we are filled with enthusiasm  purpose  and meaning. . . . We are joyously and intimately engaged with our world. This is the experience of authentic power.
data.author: Gary Zukav

data.quote: We have a tendency to obscure the forest of simple joys with the trees of problems.
data.author: Christiane Collange

data.quote: People need joy quite as much as clothing. Some of them need it far more.
data.author: Margaret Collier Graham

data.quote: When large numbers of people share their joy in common  the happiness of each is greater because each adds fuel to the other's flame.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Joys divided are increased.
data.author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

data.quote: You increase your joy by increasing the pure joy of others.
data.author: Torkom Saraydarian

data.quote: Joy increases as you give it  and diminishes as you try to keep it for yourself. In giving it  you will accumulate a deposit of joy greater than you ever believed possible.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: As you express joy  you draw it out of those you meet  creating joyful people and joyful events. The greater the joy you express  the more joy you experience.
data.author: Arnold Patent

data.quote: When we feel joyful  euphoric  happy  we are more open to life  more capable of seeing things clearly and handling daily tensions.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: If we could learn how to balance rest against effort  calmness against strain  quiet against turmoil  we would assure ourselves of joy in living and psychological health for life.
data.author: Josephine Rathbone

data.quote: Simplicity  clarity  singleness: these are the attributes that give our lives power and vividness and joy.
data.author: Richard Halloway

data.quote: Joy is not in things  it is in us.
data.author: Richard Wagner

data.quote: Joy is the feeling of grinning on the inside.
data.author: Melba Colgrove

data.quote: Joy is the will which labors  which overcomes obstacles  which knows triumph.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory  and in creative action  that man finds his supreme joy.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: I believe humans were born to have joy and to have it more abundantly  that the birthright of everyone is loving  caring  sharing  and abundance.
data.author: Peter McWiluams

data.quote: Joy is your birthright.
data.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

data.quote: Blessed are the joymakers.

data.quote: Although a lot can be learned from adversity  most of the same lessons can be learned through laughter and joy.
data.author: Peter McWilliams

data.quote: So when you're lonely or sad or bad or blue remember where laughter's hiding . . . it's hiding inside of YOU!
data.author: David Saltzman

data.quote: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: In every job  relationship  or life situation there is inevitably some turbulence. Learn to laugh at it. It is part of what you do and who you are

data.quote: Laughter puts your brain  your central nervous system and your whole being into a state of free play.

data.quote: Laughing deeply is living deeply.
data.author: Milan Kundera

data.quote: It has always seemed to me that hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
data.author: Norman Cousins

data.quote: A good belly laugh is like taking your liver for a horseback ride.
data.author: Bonny Clark

data.quote: He laughs best whose laugh lasts.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: Shared laughter is like throwing open the shutters in a gloomy room and letting in fresh air and sunshine.
data.author: Lila Green

data.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human race.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Shared laughter is love made audible.
data.author: Izzy Gesell

data.quote: A good laugh helps us recognize how ridiculous it is to get excited about matters that are often trivial. . . .
data.author: Arthur Asa Berger

data.quote: Laughter is the brush that sweeps away the cobwebs of the heart.
data.author: Mort Walker

data.quote: When we can laugh through our tears  we are being given a powerful message. Things may be bad  but they cannot be all that bad.
data.author: Allen Klein

data.quote: The child in you  like all children  loves to laugh  to be around people who can laugh at themselves and life. Children instinctively know that the more laughter we have in our lives  the better.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: Laughter is a gift everyone should open.
data.author: Gene Mitchener

data.quote: In the true man there is a child concealed - who wants to play.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Play keeps us vital and alive. It gives us an enthusiasm for life that is irreplaceable. Without it  life just doesn't taste good.
data.author: Lucia Capacchione

data.quote: It's good to play  and you must keep in practice.
data.author: Jerry Seinfeld

data.quote: The supreme accomplishment is to blur the line between work and play.
data.author: Arnold Toynbee

data.quote: A little work  a little play  To keep us going - and so  good-day!
data.author: George Du Maurier

data.quote: Every time a man smiles  and much more when he laughs  it adds something to his fragment of life.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: What sunshine is to flowers  smiles are to humanity. They are but trifles  to be sure  but  scattered along life's pathway  the good they do is inconceivable.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: It's easy enough to be pleasant when everything goes like a song  but the man who is worthwhile  is the man who can smile  when everything goes dead wrong.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If you have made another person on this earth smile  your life has been worthwhile.
data.author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

data.quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Of all the things you wear  your expression is the most important.
data.author: Janet Lane

data.quote: It is only through love that we can attain to communion with God. All living knowledge of God rest upon this foundation: that we experience Him in our lives as Will-to-love.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: That word is love.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: It makes no difference how deeply seated may be the trouble  how hopeless the outlook  how muddled the tangle  how great the mistake. A sufficient realization of love will dissolve it all. If only you could love enough you would be the happiest and most powerful being in the world.
data.author: Emmet Fox

data.quote: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: There is only one happiness in life  to love and be loved.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: Let no one who loves be called unhappy. Even love unreturned has its rainbow.
data.author: J. M. Barrie

data.quote: What a grand thing  to be loved! What a grander thing still  to lovel
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
data.author: David Viscott

data.quote: Love . . . binds everything together in perfect harmony.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: For love ... is the blood of life  the power of reunion in the separated.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: It is this intangible thing  love in many forms  which enters into every therapeutic relationship. . . . And it is an element which binds and heals  which comforts and restores  which works what we have to call - for now - miracles.
data.author: Karl Menninger

data.quote: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love  the more they give  the more they possess.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Love sought is good  but given unsought is better.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Don't shut love out of your life by saying it's impossible to find time. The quickest way to receive love is to give  the fastest way to lose love is to hold it too tightly  and the best way to keep love is to give it wings.
data.author: Brian Dyson

data.quote: The love we give away is the only one we keep.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: If you would be loved  love and be lovable.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: The issue is not so much being loved but being loving  which leads to the same wonderful feeling you experience when someone loves you.
data.author: Carol Pearson

data.quote: Everybody forgets the basic thing: people are not going to love you unless you love them.
data.author: Pat Carroll

data.quote: A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world: everyone you meet is your mirror.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: Nine times out of ten  when you extend your arms to someone  they will step in  because basically they need precisely what you need.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Love your enemies because they bring out the best in you.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.
data.author: Tom Hannah

data.quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you "love" your neighbor  act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone  you will presently come to love him.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Love is a force that connects us to every strand of the universe  an unconditional state that characterizes human nature  a form of knowledge that is always there for us if only we can open ourselves to it.
data.author: Emily Hilburn Sell

data.quote: When we connect with ourselves in love  we can connect with others and the planet in love.
data.author: Rattana Hetzel

data.quote: Choose to be a love-finder rather than a faultfinder.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: If you judge people  you have no time to love them.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Someday  after we have mastered the winds  the waves  the tide and gravity  we shall harness for God the energies of love. Then  for the second time in the history of the world  man will have discovered fire.
data.author: Teilhard de Chardin

data.quote: Love keeps the cold out better than a cloak.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: In the coldest February  as in every other month in every other year  the best thing to hold on to in this world is each other.
data.author: Linda Ellerbee

data.quote: True love always brings joy to ourself and to the one we love. If our love does not bring joy to both of us  it is not true love.
data.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

data.quote: True love comes quietly  without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells  get your ears checked.
data.author: Erich Segal

data.quote: True love is night jasmine  a diamond in darkness  the heartbeat no cardiologist has ever heard. It is the most common of miracles  fashioned of fleecy clouds - a handful of stars tossed into the night sky.
data.author: Jim Bishop

data.quote: The essence of love is kindness.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Love is what we were born with. Fear is what we learned here.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: Love is letting go of fear.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident  a tight girdle  a higher tax bracket  or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
data.author: Judith Viorst

data.quote: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them  there ought to be as many for love.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: Every single one of us can do things that no one else can do can love things that no one else can love . . . We are like violins. We can be used for doorstops  or we can make music.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: But some emotions don't make a lot of noise. It's hard to hear pride. Caring is real faint - like a heartbeat. And pure love why  some days it's so quiet  you don't even know it's there.

data.quote: Love is not what we become but who we already are.
data.author: Stephen Levine

data.quote: Ultimately  love is self-approval.
data.author: Sondra Ray

data.quote: Love is  above all  the gift of oneself.

data.quote: You must love yourself before you love another. By accepting yourself and fully being what you are . . . your simple presence can make others happy.
data.author: Jane Roberts

data.quote: Forget the resolutions. Forget control and discipline . . . too much work. Instead try experimenting. Go in search of something to fall in love with. . . something about yourself  your career  your spouse.

data.quote: Find something you love to do and you'll never have to work a day in your life.
data.author: Harvey Mackay

data.quote: You will find  as you look back upon your life  that the moments when you really lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: We are most alive when we're in love.

data.quote: In our life there is a single color  as on an artist's palette  which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.

data.quote: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: No one who has ever brought up a child can doubt for a moment that love is literally the life-giving fluid of human existence.
data.author: Smiley Blanton

data.quote: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough. Not only have I found that when I talk to the little flower or to the little peanut they will give up their secrets  but I have found that when I silently commune with people they give up their secrets also - if you love them enough.
data.author: George Washington Carver

data.quote: Spend a moment  every day  thinking of someone to love.

data.quote: Ultimately love is everything.

data.quote: Love is how you stay alive  even after you are gone.

data.quote: Medicine is my lawful wife. Literature is my mistress.

data.quote: One hears about life all the time from different people with very different narrative gifts.

data.quote: The essay is a literary device for saying almost everything about almost anything.

data.quote: The answers you get from literature depend upon the questions you pose.

data.quote: The classics are only primitive literature. They belong to the same class as primitive machinery and primitive music and primitive medicine.

data.quote: Biography is one of the new terrors of death.

data.quote: A biography is considered complete if it merely accounts for six or seven selves  whereas a person may well have as many as a thousand.

data.quote: In literature as in love we are astounded by what is chosen by others.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: Good children's literature appeals not only to the child in the adult  but to the adult in the child.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Literature flourishes best when it is half a trade and half an art.

data.quote: The great standard of literature as to purity and exactness of style is the Bible.

data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Literature is my Utopia. Here I am not disfranchised. No barrier of the senses shuts me out from the sweet  gracious discourse of my book-friends. They talk to me without embarrassment or awkwardness.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The classics are only primitive literature. They belong to the same class as primitive machinery and primitive music and primitive medicine.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: The difference between literature and journalism is that journalism is unreadable  and literature is not read.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Logic is logic. That's all I say.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Logic is neither a science nor an art  but a dodge.
data.author: Benjamin Jowett

data.quote: Grammar is the logic of speech  even as logic is the grammar of reason.

data.quote: A mighty mass of brick  and smoke  and shipping  Dirty and dusty  but as wide as eye Could reach  with here and there a sail just skipping In sight  then lost amidst the forestry Of masts  a wilderness of steeples peeping On tiptoe through their sea-coal canopy  A huge  dun cupola  like a fools-cap crown On a fool's head - and there is London Town.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: London is a roost  for every bird.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: To be adult is to be alone (etre adulte  c'est etre seul).
data.author: Jean Rostand

data.quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Loneliness is and always has been the central and inevitable experience of every man.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: One may have a blazing hearth in one's soul  and yet no one ever comes to sit by it.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: So lonely 'twas that God himself scarce seemed there to be.

data.quote: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.

data.quote: Man's loneliness is but his fear of life.

data.quote: No man is an Island intire of it self  every man is a peece of the Continent  a part of the maine  if a Clod be washed away by the sea  Europe is the lesse  as well as if a Promontorie were  as well as if a manor of thy friends or thine own were. Any man's death diminishes me because I am involved in Mankinde  and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls  it tolls for thee.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Who knows what true loneliness is - not the conventional word but the naked terror? To the lonely themselves it wears a mask. The most miserable outcast hugs some memory or some illusion.

data.quote: Little do men perceive what solitude is  and how far it extendeth. For a crowd is not company  and faces are but a gallery of pictures  and talk but a tinkling cymbal  where there is no love.

data.quote: Where you used to be  there is a hole in the world  which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime  and falling into at night. I miss you like hell.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: The eternal quest of the individual human being is to shatter his loneliness.

data.quote: Language has created the word 'loneliness' to express the pain of being alone  and the word 'solitude' to express the glory of being alone.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: If I'm such a legend  then why am I so lonely? Let me tell you  legends are all very well if you've got somebody around who loves you.

data.quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.

data.quote: I base most of my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.

data.quote: The only thing that can stop hair from falling ... is the floor.

data.quote: I'm not offended by all the dumb blonde jokes because I know I'm not dumb . . . and I also know that I'm not blonde.

data.quote: It's good to know that there's a fine line between an "outfit" and a "getup."

data.quote: Her figure is harder to ignore than a ringing telephone.

data.quote: What a man enjoys about a woman's clothes are his fantasies of how she would look without them.

data.quote: A big advantage of being bald is that you can style your hair with a damp cloth.

data.quote: His toupee makes him look twenty years sillier.

data.quote: The most delightful advantage of being bald one can hear the snowflakes.

data.quote: He looked as if he had been poured into his clothes and had forgotten to say "when."

data.quote: I've put on a lot of weight... I only weighed six and a half pounds when I was born.

data.quote: They say tall people live a lot longer than short people. No they don't. They're just so irritating it seems they are around a lot longer.

data.quote: I'm tired of all this nonsense about beauty being only skin deep. That's deep enough. What do you want  an adorable pancreas?

data.quote: My sister says she never seems to get it together . . . either her rear looks good or her face does.

data.quote: He has more chins than a Chinese phone book.

data.quote: I look just like the girl next door ... if you happen to live next door to an amusement park.

data.quote: It's not wrinkles. I just have too much skin for the size of my face.

data.quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.

data.quote: I resent my barber when he charges the full cost after he cuts my hair  but he says he's charging me for finding it.

data.quote: Definition of a bridegroom: A man who is amazed at the outcome of what he thought was a harmless little flirtation.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We have found that the best way for our marriage to work is to let me make the big decisions and my wife the small ones. With this system  I'm noticing  there are usually no big ones.

data.quote: Before criticizing your wife's faults  remember that they may have prevented her from getting a better husband.

data.quote: Love cannot accept what it is. Everywhere on earth it cries out against kindness  compassion  intelligence  everything that leads to compromise. Love demands the impossible  the absolute  the sky on fire  inexhaustible springtime  life after death  and death itself transfigured into eternal life.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: unlove's the heavenless hell and homeless home . . . lovers alone wear sunlight.

data.quote: Man loves little and often  woman much and rarely.

data.quote: The first sigh of love is the last of wisdom.

data.quote: Of all the girls that are so smart There's none like pretty Sally  She is the darling of my heart  And lives in our alley.

data.quote: There's no love lost between us.

data.quote: Love is a conflict between reflexes and reflections.
